batch_results.title: PCI Secure Software 1.1.a

new_functions_needed.name: s3_bucket_sensitive_data_identification
new_functions_needed.rationale: Identify sensitive data stored in S3 buckets by examining object metadata and tags.

new_functions_needed.name: rds_sensitive_data_identification
new_functions_needed.rationale: Identify sensitive data stored in RDS instances by examining database configurations and tags.

new_functions_needed.name: ec2_instance_sensitive_data_identification
new_functions_needed.rationale: Identify sensitive data processed by EC2 instances by examining instance metadata and tags.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing functions directly identify sensitive data across AWS services. New functions are needed to programmatically identify sensitive data in S3, RDS, and EC2.

batch_results.title: PCI Secure Software 1.1.b

new_functions_needed.name: ec2_instance_storage_sensitive_data_check
new_functions_needed.rationale: Check for sensitive data stored in EC2 instance volumes by examining volume tags and metadata.

new_functions_needed.name: rds_instance_storage_sensitive_data_check
new_functions_needed.rationale: Check for sensitive data stored in RDS snapshots by examining snapshot tags and metadata.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing functions directly check for sensitive data storage locations. New functions are needed to identify sensitive data in EC2 and RDS storage.

batch_results.title: PCI Secure Software 1.1.c

new_functions_needed.name: lambda_function_sensitive_data_protection_check
new_functions_needed.rationale: Check for security controls protecting sensitive data in Lambda functions by examining environment variables and configurations.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing functions cover encryption for S3, RDS, and EC2, but additional checks are needed for Lambda functions to ensure comprehensive coverage of security controls for sensitive data.
